I think you'd be surprised by how recent the studies are which are trying to figure out if monkeys have an inner experience, a world model or even can be considered conscious in the same way as humans are.

I don't think this statement is correct - `We don't even grant consciousness to monkeys, even though they're obviously intelligent and can be trained to do remarkably complex chores.`. 

IMO, all intelligent animals are considered conscious by majority of people.

Hi I’m Jim, coming back to NS on May 1. Good to e-meet so many inspiring NS members. Big thanks to Balaji and NS admin team for Network School. I am grateful for the continuous opportunity to learn from everyone at Network School and to network. My intro (for NS pals)

👷 Professionally: Consulting, infrastructure/transportation, agribusiness, and more recently in education.

🌏 Network state/society community discussion participation: 1729, Plumia discussion groups, Network Society Camp, TNS Connect Writers, Network School v1, etc.

👨‍🍼 Personally: Raising two young sons who I hope become Netizens.

📖 Areas of interest, research, and hoping to learn:
* How the network could enable us to transcend nation state boundaries and identity stack. (The nation state through passports/national ID/SS # define our identity stack from birth to death…could that change?)

* How network societies could become multi-generational and develop more innovative educational paths. (I hope my sons and others in their generation continue the momentum to grow up and be educated as Netizens.)

* How network strength could help diaspora communities survive amid geopolitical tensions and fearmongering. (As Chinese-American I worry about Sinophobia & McCarthyism/yellow peril narratives like what happened in Indonesia in 1990’s; anti-Chinese diaspora sentiment on the rise in Philippines where I am based.) 

* Tech, AI, blockchain/crypto/BTC, astronomy/cosmology, history, and life extension

Hi everyone!

I’m Gabi, and I’ll be arriving with my husband and our sons on April 1st (my husband, @undefined , has already introduced himself above).  🥳 

I was born in Budapest, Hungary🇭🇺 , but I also lived in Mexico 🇲🇽  and Brazil 🇧🇷 as a child. For the past three years, we’ve been living in Bali. 🌴 

Originally, I trained as a lawyer and worked in television before having kids, mainly in international program acquisitions. Then, in 2013, my husband founded MrCoin, Hungary’s first Bitcoin exchange, and I was involved in that journey as well. <:bitcoin:1282286965794017280> It was incredibly exciting to introduce the then-unknown concept of Bitcoin to Hungary and to help build and educate the community around it. We organized Bitcoin film festivals, gave talks, and produced the Bitcoin segment for Hungary’s most well-known financial radio show weekly for many years. One of the highlights of this journey was unveiling the world’s first Satoshi statue in Budapest, which has since become a global symbol of Satoshi. We’re very proud of that! Fun fact: the statue was originally planned to have a hat, I was the one who convinced the team that the statue absolutely had to have a hood. 🙃 .  

I’m not a tech person by nature — I’m more interested in how technology and society influence each other. This applies to both cryptocurrencies and AI. I’m not so much focused on what happens at the code level, but rather how these innovations can be used for the benefit of humanity, maximizing their positive impact while minimizing potential risks. ❤️ ☮️ 🫂 

I have a deep passion for working with children. 💗 🚸 As a UNICEF volunteer for years, I helped run interactive workshops on children's rights and the realities of kids living in different parts of the world. I’m a Third Culture Kid (TCK), and my sons are as well, so I have extensive experience—both as a former TCK myself and now as a parent—on what it means to grow up across multiple countries. I understand the advantages and challenges of this lifestyle and how to enhance the positives while mitigating the difficulties. I even wrote a children's book on this topic, which won the "Children’s Book of the Year" award in Hungary in 2024. Additionally, I run educational Facebook groups in Hungary on topics like TCK kids, as well as women and AI. I am the co-founder of an indie book publishing company in Hungary called Zazie Books.

Beyond this, I have a background in journalism, political analysis, mediation, and coaching. I’m currently furthering my education to specialize in coaching children as well. 👩‍🎓 

My father was a member of Hungary’s first freely elected government after the fall of the communist regime, which gave me a deep insight from a young age into how a traditional nation-state operates. This, along with my legal background, makes it fascinating for me to rethink the role and function of the state from the ground up. This is one reason why I find NS so exciting. My husband and I also share a goal of creating a space, school, and workshops for the children of NS residents — ensuring they can grow and evolve alongside the adults. After all, while we’re trying to figure out what the future will look like, they are the ones who will live in it the longest, so I believe it's essential to involve them in shaping it. 🚀 

I have no harmful addictions—unless you count books, movies, and contemporary art and architecture... 😊

I’m really looking forward to getting to know all of you and would love to chat and exchange ideas on any of these topics. See you soon! 🙂 😍

Hi everyone, I am Nikolaus (Nik), born in Austria (Europe, no kangaroos). Programming the new earth / heaven on earth economy. 

I moved to silicon valley when it was cool, at Apple ATG initially, later some startups, then left before it became uncool, was a digital nomad in Thailand, living the dream, mountain villa, wife,  2 kids, car - then ended up taking 3 years off on a spiritual path, sat with teachers and Gurus, became determined to reach enlightenment, meditated, found the most direct teachings, ended up in Bali without the ex-wife but with the kids which was / is epic, they are the best 😉 
One day, I became aware of reality - and that was enough for me and I got the message, back to work now! The next day, I was hired as CTO of an ICO play - it fell apart quickly, but I learned a lot. Then I worked on Seeds and Hypha DAO, a conscious currency and a DAO platform. 

I am very much interested in the idea of network state; it is very clear to me that society is collapsing, not fit for a new state of consciousness emerging on earth, and the vision was always to build the new earth instead of fighting the old. Been on this journey for 6 years now - it's going to happen. 

Burning man was my inspiration for what an utopian society can look like - everyone volunteers, everyone does what they like to do, and everything gets done synchronistically. A giving economy. 

But before we get there on a large scale and in the real world, blockchain is our bridge - to get out of the money slave system and create peace on earth. Any currency that's not corrupted basically would do - but blockchain is a technology that just so happens to fit the bill.  

Excited to meet you all on March 1st!

Hey everyone,

I’m Barnabas, originally from Budapest, Hungary. I grew up as an expat kid in Algeria and have been living in Bali for the past three years.

I consider myself a builder, with a strong software engineering background—I started coding at five. I love solving problems that others think are unsolvable, with a strong emphasis on user experience. Growing up in Algeria and then in a post-Soviet country, I failed a lot and learned to crawl through broken glass to make it. I’m a cockroach, not a unicorn. A cockroach with a Liberland passport 🙂

I’m excited to join the Network School because I rarely meet like-minded individuals who are extreme risk-takers, fanatically love reimagining difficult problems from first principles, and embrace, learn from, and enjoy all the associated challenges.
 

**Things I value:**
• **Human connections** – Honesty, Empathy, Love
• **Self-sovereignty, Liberty** – NAP, Voluntarism
• **Spending time offline** – Enjoying the analogue waves
• **Building online** – Crunching digital bits
  

**Things I care about:**
• The future of society
• Posthumanism
• Everything that can be derived from the above two:
    • Detaching from the legacy system to become free, borderless, and crypto-native
    • Building a new societal blueprint
    • Safe superintelligence
    • Health, safe food, longevity, sports
    • 22nd-century education
    • Preparing for what’s to come in the next five years - and what's to come after

  
**A few fun things I’ve done:**

• Got together with a dozen people to create a community/village of like-minded techno-optimists. The project failed, but I learned a lot about biointensive farming—and it’s also where I discovered Bitcoin (this was in 2010). Back then, we used Bitcoin as money to trade veggies, land, labor, etc. No one thought of it as “HODL never spend digital gold.”

• Bootstrapped Hungary’s crypto ecosystem—[founded the first exchange/brokerage](https://mrcoin.eu) (since exited), launched ATMs (with a highly ranked central bank officer [praising Bitcoin at the inaugural event](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sDvEgqsbZow)😅), organized educational workshops, meetups, etc. Fun fact: We have the longest-running [Bitcoin Meetup](http://www.bitcoinbudapest.hu) in the world!

• Erected the first [Satoshi Statue](https://www.youtube.com/live/em74TdeSsbw?t=2363s) in Budapest, which became a pilgrimage site for crypto enthusiasts (and is now the default “Satoshi image” in the press).

• Built a small GPU rig to learn about mining—and it ended up mining Ethereum’s [genesis block](https://x.com/keo/status/1272844823834308608).

• Helped fund and bootstrap a pirate microschool/homeschooling club for my son 10 years ago because we couldn’t find any alternatives we were happy with. This later became a state-accredited [decentralized network of 18 microschools](https://budapestschool.org/en/) with 800+ students in Hungary.

• Co-founded [Reaction](https://reaction.global) with Stanford Executive Program classmates—a VC fund focused on solving important problems.

Hi, this is Jim, I am excited to return to Forest City Network School for most of its final month and grateful to Balaji & NS team for the learning opportunity.

I’m Chinese-American from Midwest but mostly exited the US since around 10 years ago, first moving to Brasil and then now in Southeast Asia in the Philippines. Got two young sons who I hope to be netizens of network societies in the future. For much of my life, I’ve tried to as a neutral avoid collateral damage from the escalating US-China conflict, but the “curse” somehow always comes back — most recently in the form of nearly monthly South China Sea scares near the Philippines (which could rock the entire Indo-Pacific region) and fears of return of McCarthyism by US/US “vassals” (not so much about the “anti-Communist” part but concerns rooted in the potentially unfair and unethical targeting of particular minority disapora groups). 

I am thankful for the frameworks that Balaji has envisioned - for it gives me hope that milions of neutrals, nomads, migrants, third-culture-kids, etc can try to find peaceful independent alternate paths for themselves and their families — hopefully peacefully independent from clutches of legacy nation states that have power to commit violence, confiscation, cancellation, suspicion, persecution, and shaming of those accused of being not “nationalistic/patriotic” enough or accused of not loving “democracy” enough. 

Hoping for a future in which my kids and others in their generation would no longer be judged or limited by the color of their passport/national id/social security card. (Nowadays, to be born, to go to school, to get employed, to travel globally, to get married, to have kids, to retire, and even to die and pass on inheritance — one would need recognition from a nation state!). Nothing against nation states, respecting them, just seeking peaceful alternatives.

I look forward to learning from everyone — it is a blessing to connect with and learn from so many thinkers, innovators, entreprenuers, and aspiring network state/network society netizens in this community. I am humbled to have the chance to learn — and I hope to continue to come back to Forest City from time to time. A big thanks to Balaji and the NS team for making things happen. Cheers!

Hey everyone, George here. I discovered Balaji's 1729 community after leaving big tech out of boredom, and it's been life-changing. Since then, I've been deep in crypto, currently working at Flashbots, where we solve MEV problems and build Ethereum infrastructure like MEV-Boost. We're also exploring hardware-based solutions like TEE for credible and confidential computing (same tech used for Apple Intelligence). On the side, I invest in and advise startups and funds in the space.

My Network School goal is to step back and refocus on the big questions. I'm at a "mid-life crisis" point as a crypto builder, seeing how much of the space has drifted from the original crypto spirit. Some key concerns I have include:

1. Centralization Creep: Growing influence of institutional players (e.g., ETFs) potentially centralizing power and increasing vulnerability to attacks.
2. Speculative Casino Culture: Influx of opportunists and scammers across all levels, turning the industry into a speculative playground—where the yield/return comes from.
3. Self-Regulation Failure: Industry's struggle to self-regulate and prevent bad actors from hijacking the movement, exposing limitations of libertarian ideals.
4. Hype Over Substance: Prevalence of shallow, overhyped projects optimized for impressing retails and quick exits rather than creating real impact or sustainable business/protocol, fostering a culture of pseudo-profound but ultimately meaningless innovations.

Balaji's clear big-picture thinking was what I loved most about 1729. (I often joke he's our era's Hari Seldon, while I'm still the clueless encyclopedist – Foundation fans will get it.)

I'm here to:

1. Find my own answers to the big questions about crypto as an industry and movement
2. Get a clearer picture of our current world
3. Gain more clarity and conviction for my future path

Excited to embark on this journey with you all – can't wait to learn from you, have fun, and tackle these challenges together!
